intro: Ephedra americana, commonly known as the American ephedra, is a shrub-like plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its jointed stems and small, scale-like leaves, which are typically found in clusters. The plant produces greenish-yellow flowers and is adapted to arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Ephedra americana is part of the Ephedraceae family and is known for its historical use in traditional medicine. Its stems contain alkaloids, including ephedrine, which have been used for various medicinal purposes.
